item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, October 31, 2024 at 2:50 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Generative AI Scripting (121 points | 26 comments)
2. It might be possible to detect gravitons after all (71 points | 13 comments)
3. OpenZFS deduplication is good now and you shouldn't use it (162 points | 91 comments)
4. Chain-of-Thought Can Hurt Performance on Tasks Where Thinking Makes Humans Worse (183 points | 76 comments)
5. Wonder Animation – Video to 3D Animation (45 points | 3 comments)
6. AI Flame Graphs (192 points | 60 comments)
7. Steam games will need to disclose kernel-level anti-cheat on store pages (479 points | 296 comments)
8. Show HN: The Probability Times (13 points | 4 comments)
9. Crafting Painterly Shaders (119 points | 3 comments)
10. SimpleQA (128 points | 39 comments)
11. Cerebras Trains Llama Models to Leap over GPUs (12 points | 4 comments)
12. Google CEO says more than a quarter of the company's new code is created by AI (273 points | 454 comments)
13. Show HN: G-win – .gcode parser written in Rust with winnow (23 points | 1 comment)
14. Show HN: AI OmniGen – AI Image Generator with Consistent Visuals (103 points | 25 comments)
15. Pushing the frontiers of audio generation (173 points | 69 comments)
16. Rubocop-obsession: RuboCop extension focused on higher-level concepts (63 points | 22 comments)
17. FDA Permits Marketing of Digital Game to Improve Attention in ADHD Children (9 points | 2 comments)
18. I Attended Google's Creator Conversation Event, and It Turned into a Funeral (51 points | 6 comments)
19. An Italian 'fruit detective' who investigates centuries-old paintings (50 points | 9 comments)
20. M4 MacBook Pro (695 points | 957 comments)
21. Launch HN: FlyCode (YC S22) – Stop losing revenue due to failed payments (72 points | 55 comments)
22. Google's TOS doesn't eliminate a user's Fourth Amendment rights, judge rules [pdf] (278 points | 202 comments)
23. Show HN: Ezcrypt – A file encryption tool (simple, strong, public domain) (32 points | 36 comments)
24. Infisical (YC W23) is hiring full stack engineers (remote or in SF) ( | hide)
25. 1BRC Coding Challenge: Nerd Sniping the Java Community (119 points | 34 comments)
26. DeepSeek v2.5 – open-source LLM comparable to GPT-4, but 95% less expensive (125 points | 35 comments)
27. Show HN: LlamaPReview – AI GitHub PR reviewer that learns your codebase (81 points | 26 comments)
28. Australia/Lord_Howe is the weirdest timezone (953 points | 391 comments)
29. NASA reconnected with Voyager 1 after a brief pause (214 points | 136 comments)
30. Representing web applications as knowledge graphs (57 points | 6 comments)
